subs.text: You know what Zuck should work on, getting a network together for people who are interviewed on TV, so the quality gets a huge upgrade, and make the UI dead simple. I can't believe none of the big tech companies see this opportunity. The quality is uniformly awful.

No one knows if people want to sit in virtual reality conference rooms, but we know for sure that TV is built around a new way of discussion, and there's no prospect for this changing. So someone ought to capitalize on the vacuum.
